citation.article-title: Marichromatium litoris sp. nov. and Marichromatium chrysaorae sp. nov. isolated from beach sand and from a jelly fish (Chrysaora colorata)

p.s: Description of Marichromatium chrysaorae sp. nov.
id="par0085">chry.sa.o’ra.e. N.L. gen. n. chrysaorae, of Chrysaora, isolated from a jelly fish, C. colorata.
id="par0090">The cells of this gram-stain-negative bacterium are rod shaped, 1–1.3 μm wide and 2–5 μm long, motile with single polar flagellum and have vesicular internal membrane.
Growth occurs in anaerobic conditions in light.
Color of phototrophically grown cultures is reddish brown.
The in vivo absorption spectra of intact cells in sucrose exhibited maxima at 377, 461, 488, 590, 800 and 851 nm.
Bacteriochlorophyll a, rhodopin and spirilloxanthin are the major photosynthetic pigments.
Cells grow at 25–35 °C, pH 7–8 and NaCl, 2–6% (w/v).
Major fatty acids were C18:1ω7c, C16:1ω7c/C16:1ω6c and C16:0.
Phosphatidyl ethanolamine, diphosphatidyl glycerol, phosphatidyl glycerol and ornithine lipid are the major polar lipids.
Major quinones are Q8, MK7 and MK6.
Photolithoheterotrophic and chemolithoheterotrophic growth occurs with sulphide and thiosulfate as the electron donors and pyruvate as carbon source.
Propionate, succinate, fumarate, acetate and malate are also utilized for growth.
Lactate does not support growth whereas butyrate and valerate are weak supplements for growth.
Glutamine and ammonium chloride could be used as a nitrogen source whereas urea and glutamate do not support growth.
The DNA G + C content of the strain was 70.5 mol% (by HPLC).
The type strain JA553T (=KCTC 5998T = NBRC106082T) was isolated from a jelly fish (C. colorata) at a sea shore of Thirumullaivasal Beach, Tamil Nadu, India.
